title: Playing against ekko is rage inducing.
body: I'm so glad he isn't played often, but the few times I get him... jesus christ. In lane all he does is QQQQQQQQQQQQQ and push the wave, then if he decides to EQAA, you can do nothing about it since he gets ms to run away. After lvl 6, good luck killing him. He'll just press the oopsie button and run away or just kill you with it. But the most frustrating part for me is his wave clear since lvl 1. Just Qs and runs back to tower then he does it again and again.

replies.body: I'll rather lane against Ekko than Anivia.

I would rather lane against Ekko than most champions.

also if he pushes wave then he's an easy gank for a kill xd.

> [{quoted}](name=Yaśuo Main,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=4jGPk0Os,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2018-03-05T14:46:24.948+0000)
>
> well yas doesnt get movement speed sadly, needs a rune for that.

Or an item he builds every game.

> also if he pushes wave then he's an easy gank for a kill xd.

Unless he pushed it in to tower before the next wave arrived.  Also the enemy laner would have to walk through all those minions to help with the gank.


TBH I'm more fine with Yasuo now, but he is rather annoying.  Then again, so is almost every champion in the game (otherwise they'd be easy to beat).

>Or an item he builds every game.

If you mean PD then he still doesn't, last time I checked it doesn't say "yasuo gets free movement speed when EQAAing". If you mean he does get movement speed from exterior sources, then yes.

>Unless he pushed it in to tower before the next wave arrived. Also the enemy laner would have to walk through all those minions to help with the gank

Wouldn't that make ganking impossible? The entire point of a jungler not being unable to gank is usually because they are blocked off, or the person they gank is pushed in. So the easiest way to have a clearing to gank is to let the wave go to your tower, and not suddenly show a change to aggression once your jungler is there.

>Also the enemy laner would have to walk through all those minions to help with the gank.

As far as I know, if that was a thing then the boards would be much more enthusiastic about minion block being broken. Otherwise, that is a totally rare thing to occur.

What I meant by walk through the wave is have to move past them (itself not difficult) and take damage from all of them hitting (which hurts a lot in the early game).

Again, a lot of champs can do this sorta stuff.

The other day I played Syndra vs an Ekko and I would only ult him while he was stunned. Was pretty funny how every time I did he was confused in all chat, saying "lol, I pressed r". 

Was great fun.

And thank gawd new runes got rid of that lvl 1 Q two shotting caster minions bullshit.

Stop being a dumb. I never said anything about him not being allowed to have waveclear, I said two shotting caster minions at LEVEL 1 and then the whole wave after proc'ing passive on the melee minions is bullshit, and it was abused for obvious reasons.

Also not sure in what world someone can be hardstuck after only 45 games with a win ratio that gets champions nerfed, but I guess if you're that desperate to attack someone's ranking.

Putting words in my mouth again lmao, where did I say that's any less obnoxious?

At least Sol is easier to punish later on. P1.

He's like Yas, Zed, and even Darius. He comes across as a complete pain in the ass when you haven't fought him much before, but once you fight him in enough games and maybe get your face bashed in enough, you'll start realizing that he isn't nearly as rough as you may have thought.

Or at the very least, you feed him less.

As a midlane and compettetive minded player. Ekko is garbage tier 

Here are the reasons 

1. His Q on the way back never hits good players unless they decide to tank it ... and why would they
2. His W never hits any good player even from FOG + its telegraphed as fk. Yes I saw that dragon pit stun from Shiptur in NA.. that shit only happens on NA 
3. His R never hits any good player unless they decide to tank it 
4. His waveclear is good but his CSING isnt. If Ekko just permapushes the wave he is missing 2 cs on that wave per average
5. His dueling is subpar
6. Outclassed by Good le blanc (So me and maybe some random korean dude), Ahri (Ahri literaly outclasses ekko at all points)
7. He ll die before he uses his ultimate most of a time 


This champions has nothing going for itself except for tempo build up in rare matchups and hoping to cheese with a roam while not having that amazing ganks to begin with



If you want an actualy opressive level 1 waveclear Champion try Aurelion sol, this dragon has record for earliest ganks from mid 



So I am immensly surprised that you are having a problem with ekko .. oh wait you arent even a mid main.. explains why you have no idea thats freelo matchup


If ekko were anything but dogshit tier I would gladly play him

Honestly as someone who plays ekko... I couldn't agree more. I don't like the Q, it isn't reliable or even effective poke for the way it works and the W is only really good for the shield. I like the ultimate though, in all honesty there are much better picks than Ekko.
Ultimate is cool just not that effective

I wouldn't mind gutting his waveclear if it means he can receive other tools to maybe trade better early game.

In mid lane he'll get poked out hard and top lane he almost always loses trades against top laners.

No matter how you slice it, ekko is incentivized to play like a bitch and Q spam at max range to clear waves.
Annoying to deal with, yet balanced IMO
Having retarded supports is more rage inducing than anything

Any champion that counters my {{champion:99}}, {{champion:42}},
and {{champion:115}} are lanes that I don't like.
One of the most healthiest assassin type champions in the game. He supposed to be very slippery.
I didn't realize assassins had support-level zoning and cc on 3/4 of their spells.
Would you rather it wasn't telegraphed?

Are you talking about Q, W, or R? 

Q: I would rather it be like Ahri's Q or Swain's E, not a moving zone that continuously reapplies a 60% slow for 2.5 seconds. It's not just Ekko that's a problem here; it's also Galio, Katarina, Talon (to a lesser degree), Xayah, Azir, AP Nasus, and Taliyah. 

Abilities that deal front-loaded damage, then zone with the threat of additional damage are inherently problematic because the zoning requires no tradeoff (like Lux E) and you don't avoid all damage by leaving the zone (Maokai sapling, Illaoi, Heimer, etc). It's also a problem that these champs have incidental zoning power not factored into their power budgets, unlike champs designed for zone control (eg Zyra, GP barrels, Heimer, Teemo, Illaoi, Zilean, Cait, Mao, Cassio, Lux, Gragas, etc).

This is the exact problem with the old Yorick. His abilities dealt damage up front, then zoned with the penalty of additional damage from ghouls. It was most pronounced on him because the design was used on *all* of his abilities, but the design flaw doesn't become less flawed because it's on 1-2 abilities instead of 3. 

W: Delayed and telegraphed are two different things. The delay is 3 seconds. The telegraph is .5 seconds, which is the amount of time you have to dodge an Arcane Comet or Xerath W (and shorter than Brand W and Zyra Q).

R: Yes. First reason is because the clone is buggy as fuck and appears and disappears so often (regardless of whether Ekko is actually nearby) that's it's unreliable to play around. Second reason is that because of Ekko's fucking insane move speed, the clone is often not actually visible. 

Third reason is because playing against one Ekko requires the mindshare of tracking two moving units at all times. That's also part of the skill cap of playing him, but his players innately have more practice with the mechanic, making it more reflexive and lower mindshare. Playing against him is more demanding of attention than playing against most other champs.
